channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bins and rubbish strewn everywhere., 13th September
item.description:
The level of rubbish collection/cleaning on the Winns Common area has reduced drastically. Rubbish strewn all over both sides of the common - makes the area look really dirty and dilapidated. Please clean it up and empty the bins more regularly?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakedale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red cross has been turned into a swastika, 13th September
item.description:
Last weekend I reported a red cross and the word 'FUCK' nest to it on FMS 8127469 and the closed action smudged the words. The cross has now been turned into a swastika. Please remove everything leaving no trace URGENTLY! Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mickleham Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches are overhanging road and pavement outside my house, 13th September
item.description:
I reported this problem at the end of July and then received an e mail on 03.09.25 saying that "works had been completed " and the state changed to "fixed ". As you can see from the photos taken today the tree has not been pruned and the problem is still there . No one has come to do any work on the tree .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walnut Tree Close, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Allowing parking there is dangerous, 13th September
item.description:
On the exact point marked on the map, cars will normally park around that curb and it is extremely dangerous as it blocks the view of the driver. When cars are parked there it blocks the view of oncoming cars or it will block you from the view of other drivers. Whilst a precaution, such as driving slower, can be taken it still does not guarantee safety as other drivers may not do the same and can be driving quickly. This is not a recent issue. There have been numerous times where family members have been driving slowly around there to be safe but still almost been hit by another car as the other driver was driving too fast. This has also happened to me many times where if i wasn’t driving slowly I would’ve been hit as well. This is a serious issue because it puts multiple lives at risk. The parked cars are the issue as when the cars are not there visibility is increased and I have never experienced a situation where I have almost been hit when cars are not there. Whilst I understand that residents will need somewhere to park, there should at least be a section where you can’t park so that you can see oncoming traffic. Please find a solution for this because as someone who has to constantly use this road on a daily, it puts my life and my family’s at risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58-72, Osborne Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on shop shutter 232 Graham road E8 1BP, 13th September
item.description:
I am writing to report illegal graffiti that has been painted on my shutter (232 Graham road E8 1BP). The graffiti falsely claims that my shop is a “casino shop.” This is misleading, damaging to my business reputation, and constitutes an act of vandalism.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
